dcterms:creator: S. Morad
R. Kortvelesy
M. Bettini
S. Liwicki
A. Prorok
dcterms:description: Cartpole is the simulation of a cart with an upside-down pole where the agent has to maintain the vertical angle of the pole sufficiently small while remaining in a restricted horizontal displacement region. The system state consists of 4 dimensions: horizontal displacement and velocity, and angular displacement and velocity. The agent is just able to observe the displacements (horizontal and angular). The agentâ€™s action space consists of two actions: applying force on left or right.
dcterms:title: Cartpole

dcterms:creator: R. S. Sutton
A. G. Barto
dcterms:description: Mountain Car simulates an under-powered car which must drive up a steep hill. The car is situated in a valley and must learn to drive up the opposite hill before it can make it to the top of the desired hill. The state space consists of velocity and position, and in the partially observed version, the agent can just observe the position.
dcterms:title: Mountain Car

dcterms:description: Non-Markovian Random Walk simulates a controlled random walk where the next position depends not only on the current position and action but also on the past positions.
dcterms:title: Non-Markovian Random Walk
